thread.subject: Need to be more explicit about what expansive thinking is
thread.content: It is not obvious for most people what contenxt youare referring to the expansive thinking of the late 1990s, this is especially true given that most readers of this book will not be from a technical background.
thread.author: Ben Cawkwell

thread.subject: These dates are wrong
thread.content: The epansive thinking really started in the late 1980s, it was just later that the technology became available to implement many of the features. The lessons were learned before the turn of the millenium.
thread.author: sjn

comments.content: Perhaps change the text so that effects of expansive thinking were present in the 1980s.
comments.author: Dick Harry

thread.subject: Is this the correct way to write 1900s and 2000s?
thread.content: I thought it was normal to refer to 1900s, with only the decade and an apostrophe, like 90's. For dates after the millenium, I would assume you still keep the apostrophe, so it would be like 2000's. I am not a writer so correct me if I am wrong.
thread.author: Bob Builder
